Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for network security, traffic filtering, and application protection. Identify the applications and services that will use Azure Firewall.
Design the network architecture, including the placement of Azure Firewall within the virtual network, subnets, and integration with existing on-premises and Azure networks.
Create a dedicated subnet for Azure Firewall within the virtual network. Ensure the subnet meets the required size and naming conventions.
Deploy Azure Firewall in the designated subnet using the Azure portal, CLI, or PowerShell. Configure initial settings such as SKU and availability zones.
Set up application rules, network rules, and NAT rules to control traffic flow and enforce security policies.
Enable threat intelligence-based filtering to block traffic from known malicious IP addresses and domains.
Set up Azure Monitor to collect logs and metrics from Azure Firewall for monitoring and troubleshooting purposes.
Set up alerts and notifications for critical events such as rule violations, traffic anomalies, and firewall health status.
Apply security best practices such as restricting access to the Azure Firewall management interface and using Azure Active Directory for authentication.
Perform thorough testing of the firewall configuration, including rule enforcement, traffic filtering, and failover scenarios.
Document the Azure Firewall configuration, rules, and policies for future reference and compliance purposes.
Provide training to the operations team on managing and troubleshooting Azure Firewall, including log analysis and rule updates.
Conduct regular audits of Azure Firewall rules and configurations to ensure compliance with organizational policies and regulatory requirements.
Continuously monitor the performance and health of Azure Firewall using Azure Monitor and Network Watcher.
Regularly update firewall rules to adapt to changing security requirements and application needs.
